Package: sk.hax.software.os

[Groovy] Class Kernel

    • sk.hax.software.os.Kernel
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      Task

      final class Kernel

      Core of the HaxOS operating system. Is started when the machine boots. Provides an API for machine hardware to running tasks.

      Authors:
      mio

      • Properties Summary

          Properties 
          Type Name and description
          Machine  MACHINE
          Terminal  TERMINAL

      • Method Detail

        • java.lang.String absoluteFilePath(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String pwd)

          Turn a file path into an absolute one. If the specified path is already absolute, it is returned unchanged. Otherwise, it is made absolute using the specified working directory.

          Parameters:
          path - path to turn to an absolute one
          pwd - current working directory
          Returns:
          path on input turned to an absolute one

        • boolean existsFile(java.lang.String path)

          Check if the specified path exists on the underlying storage.

          Parameters:
          path - path to check for
          Returns:
          true if a file exists on the path, false otherwise

        • boolean existsFile(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String pwd)

          Check if the specified path exists on the underlying storage.

          Parameters:
          path - path to check for
          pwd - current working directory, used for resolving a relative path
          Returns:
          true if a file exists on the path, false otherwise

        • java.lang.String getMachineName()

          Get the name of the machine.

          Returns:
          machine name

        • java.lang.String getNetworkAddress()

          Get the currently assigned network address of the machine.

          Returns:
          string representation of the network address

        • boolean isPortOpen(int port)

          Check whether the specified port is currently open.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to check
          Returns:
          true if the port is open (assigned to a task), false otherwise

        • boolean isTaskRunning(Task task)

          Check if the specified task is running. The check is performed by looking for the specified task instance in the task list.

          Parameters:
          task - task instance to check for
          Returns:
          true if the task instance is present in the task list, false otherwise

        • java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> listFiles(java.lang.String path)

          List all the files contained in the directory with the specified path.

          Parameters:
          path - directory whose content to list
          Returns:
          list of files in the directory, empty if the directory does not exist or is empty

        • java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> listFiles(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String pwd)

          List all the files contained in the directory with the specified path.

          Parameters:
          path - directory whose content to list
          pwd - current working directory, used for resolving a relative path
          Returns:
          list of files in the directory, empty if the directory does not exist or is empty

        • java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer, OutboundChannel> listPorts()

          Get a map of all currently open ports.

          Returns:
          map of all open ports along with their channels

        • java.util.List<Task> listTasks()

          Get a list of all currently running task instances.

          Returns:
          unmodifiable list of running tasks

        • Channel openPort(int port)

          Open the specified network port and get an asynchronous channel for communicating through it. Is used when the port number does matter, usually for server side tasks.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to open
          Returns:
          asynchronous channel for communicating through the port

        • Channel openPort(Task task)

          Open some port for the specified task and get an asynchronous channel for communicating through it. Is used when the port number does not matter, usually for client side tasks.

          Parameters:
          task - task instance
          Returns:
          asynchronous channel for communicating through some port

        • SyncChannel openSyncPort(int port)

          Open the specified network port and get a synchronous channel for communicating through it. Is used when the port number does matter, usually for server side tasks.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to open
          Returns:
          synchronous channel for communicating through the port

        • SyncChannel openSyncPort(Task task)

          Open some port for the specified task, and get a synchronous channel for communicating through it. Is used when the port number does not matter, usually for client side tasks.

          Parameters:
          task - task instance
          Returns:
          synchronous channel for communicating through some port

        • Task prepareTask(java.lang.Object object)

          Build a task instance from the specified task object. The task object may be a string, a byte array or a class.

          Parameters:
          object - string (Groovy script) or byte array (JAR file) representing the task
          Returns:
          task instance, null if an error occurs when building it

        • Task prepareTaskByName(java.lang.String name)

          Build a task instance from the specified task name.

          Parameters:
          name - qualified name of the task to build
          Returns:
          task instance, null if an error occurs when building it

        • Task prepareTaskFromScript(java.lang.String script, java.lang.String extension)

          Build a task instance from the specified script in the specified scripting language. Uses JSR223 functionality to find the correct scripting engine to process the script with.

          throws:
          Exception if the task creation fails
          Parameters:
          script - text representation of the script
          extension - identifier of the scripting engine, equal to the script file extension
          Returns:
          task instance
          See Also:
          javax.script.ScriptEngineManager

        • java.lang.Object readFile(java.lang.String path)

          Read the file on the specified path.

          Parameters:
          path - path to read
          Returns:
          object contained on the path, null if it does not exist

        • java.lang.Object readFile(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String pwd)

          Read the file on the specified path.

          Parameters:
          path - path to read
          pwd - current working directory, used for resolving a relative path
          Returns:
          object contained on the path, null if it does not exist

        • void removeFile(java.lang.String path)

          Remove the file or directory on the specified path from the storage.

          Parameters:
          path - directory or file to remove

        • void removeFile(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String pwd)

          Remove the file or directory on the specified path from the storage.

          Parameters:
          path - directory or file to remove
          pwd - current working directory, used for resolving a relative path

        • void restart()

          Restart the machine.

        • void setNetworkAddress(java.lang.String address)

          Set the network address of the machine to the specified one.

          Parameters:
          address - string representation of the network address

        • void setTaskProperty(Task task, java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object value)

          Set the specified property on the specified task instance to the specified value. If the task does not have a property of such name, the method does nothing.

          Parameters:
          task - task instance
          name - property name
          value - property value

        • void shutdown()

          Shut down the machine.

        • @java.lang.Override void start()

        • void startTask(Task task, Terminal terminal)

          Start the specified task instance. Sets the KERNEL and TERMINAL properties for the task. Adds the task to the task list. Starts the task. If the task startup fails, throws an exception. If the task is not a resident task (by means of the RESIDENT property being 'true'), stops the task immediately.

          Parameters:
          task - task instance
          terminal - associated terminal

        • @java.lang.Override void stop()

        • void stopTask(Task task)

          Stop the specified task instance. Shuts down the task and removes it from the task list.

          Parameters:
          task - task instance to stop

        • void stopTask(int id)

          Stop the task instance with the specified index (0-based) in the task list.

          Parameters:
          id - index of the task in the task list

        • void writeFile(java.lang.String path, java.lang.Object data)

          Write the specified data to the file on the specified path. If the file exists, its content is replaced, otherwise a new file is created.

          Parameters:
          path - path of the file
          data - content of the file

        • void writeFile(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String pwd, java.lang.Object data)

          Write the specified data to the file on the specified path. If the file exists, its content is replaced, otherwise a new file is created.

          Parameters:
          path - path of the file
          pwd - current working directory, used for resolving a relative path
          data - content of the file
